Compute Iterative LSI

addIterativeLSI.Rd

This function will compute an iterative LSI dimensionality reduction on an ArchRProject.

addIterativeLSI(ArchRProj = NULL, useMatrix = "TileMatrix",
  reducedDimsOut = "IterativeLSI", iterations = 3, dimsToUse = 1:25,
  corCutOff = 0.75, LSIMethod = 1, binarize = TRUE,
  sampleCells = max(c(floor(nCells(ArchRProj)/4), 5000)),
  varFeatures = 50000, selectionMethod = "var", scaleTo = 10000,
  totalFeatures = 5e+05, filterQuantile = 0.99,
  saveIterations = TRUE, outDir = getOutputDirectory(ArchRProj),
  clusterParams = list(), runHarmony = FALSE, harmonyParams = list(),
  threads = 1, seed = 1, verboseHeader = TRUE, verboseAll = FALSE,
  force = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

ArchRProj

ArchRProject
useMatrix

use matrix for LSI clustering from Arrow
reducedDimsOut

name of dimensionality reduction to be stored as
iterations

number of LSI iterations to perform
dimsToUse

number of dimensions to compute and use from LSI (TFIDF-SVD) for clustering
binarize

binarize matrix prior to LSI
sampleCells

number of cells to sample for LSI estimation
varFeatures

number of variable features to use for LSI
selectionMethod

selection method for variable features (var or vmr)
scaleTo

scaleTo for Cluster Averages for variance calculation
totalFeatures

number of features to consider (ranked by total number of counts) use for LSI
filterQuantile

filter features for initial LSI that are above this quantile
saveIterations

save LSI iterations as rds in the outDir
outDir

output directory for saving LSI iterations
clusterParams

additional params to pass to addClusters
runHarmony

run harmony batch correction through the iterations
harmonyParams

additional params to pass to harmony
threads

number of threads for parallel execution
seed

seed for analysis
verboseHeader

verbose sections
verboseAll

verbose sections and subsections
force

verbose sections and subsections
...

additional args

Contents

  • Arguments
